Articles.Content:
Hey all a bit of a weird question, but I'm really failing my Google-fu with this one and I need help from other science nerds.  KSP forum is as best a place as any.

So back in 2009, National Geographic actually shown the show called "Alien Worlds".  It was about exo-planet detection and had a lot of familiar names in it, like Jeff Marcy.
I really loved that show and I had it saved on my PVR (which crashed in 2012). Ever since I've been trying to acquire the DvD (or better yet, the BluRay) of that single-episode show, to no avail.

All I am finding is the American version called "Alien Earths" which is almost identical, but I do not like the Narrator and I really want the UK version called "Alien Worlds".
I found it on Youtube, and in case ou are wondering what I am talking about, it's this (see below):

So if anyone knows of a place where I could get my hands on the DvD/BluRay... PLEASE END MY SUFFERING and tell me where to purchase it.
Thanks and have a good night all !

Stupid question, but have you tried Amazon?  

Hmmm...  Hang on a minute, looks interesting,  I'll have a quick look myself.....

Ok, I just tried that, but without success, all that turns up are thing that seem to be aimed at kids, which don't look like what you are looking for, never mind.  It may be worth you checking though (if you haven't already) as you know what you are looking for better than I do.

Just updating that I did not find anything.  I was able to find a non-HD file of that show, and assuming I get a tVto read usb keys one day, I now have the show, but no official source.

E-BAY might be my final resort, but I've not been satisfied with E-Bay as a whole.  Might have to tho.

 

I'm in no hurry, if anyone finds it, let me know.  Or if you own it and don't mind getting rid of it, let me know as well.
